task_description: Facing the building to your East (approx. 104°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I can't see the full height of the building; I need to look up to see the roof and then down to see the base to make an accurate estimation.
I have seen the top of the building by looking up; now I need to look down to see the base to estimate the full height.

Having viewed the top of the building at a 30-degree upward pitch and the base at a 30-degree downward pitch, I can now estimate its height by counting the floors; it appears to be approximately 7 stories tall, and assuming each story is about 3.5 meters, the total height is around 24.5 meters.
